thread.title: W.Va. receives $200K to assist small business exporters
thread.title_full: W.Va. receives $200K to assist small business exporters

title: W.Va. receives $200K to assist small business exporters
text:
West Virginia receives $200K federal grant to help small businesses with export activities 
  8/25/15 3:00 am EDT - Updated: 8/25/15 3:02 am EDT 
CHARLESTON, West Virginia â€” West Virginia has received a $200,000 federal grant to help small businesses export goods to international markets. 
Gov. Earl Ray Tomblin announced the U.S. Small Business Administration funding Monday. 
The money goes to the West Virginia Development Office for a program that helps qualifying small businesses offset their export marketing activities. That includes things like Development Office trade missions, international trade shows and "Trade Winds" conferences organized by the U.S. Commercial Service. 
Direct assistance will also be available to West Virginia exhibitors at the 2016 Mine Expo International show.
